taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section setosi;species benneri;

treatment.description: Resembling no. 127, but with leaves soft-pubescent beneath; up to 2 m, high.; primocane-leaflets abruptly long-acuminate; petioles of floricane-leaves glandless; racemose-corymbose inflorescence with glandless axis but densely glandular pedicels.
